text: (inspiring music)
- AvalonBay is one

of the largest publicly traded
real estate companies focused
in the multifamily space.

We are vertically
integrated with a strong DNA

in real estate development
and property operations.
We have close to 300 communities
totaling about 90,000 apartment homes.
Prior to working with AWS,
we were challenged by data technology.
We had largely an on-prem presence

with physical hardware and
inflexible architecture

and poor visibility into
platform performance.
To our customers that resulted
in customer experiences that were full

of friction across the
digital journeys with us.

We came up with a vision
to build a platform
that is customer-centric and delivers

on what we call R cubed,
real-time, relevant and reliable.

- AWS helped us make our
vision for a reimagined,
stellar customer experience a reality.

We are partnered closely
with AWS solution architects

and account executives,
enabling us to know
the services that are available for us.
- We use a number of AWS services,

including Amazon
OpenSearch and AWS Lambda.
For us the customer experience begins

when people are searching
for an apartment.

Utilizing these services,
customers can visit our website,
see which apartments are available,

what amenities they have and
the price, all in real time.
- We are now even piloting AWS services

to do things like managing
community maintenance,
resident package delivery, with plans
to scale this across our entire portfolio,

to enable us to optimize our
operations at our communities.

- We have so much potential
to what we can do,
thanks to AWS' well-architected framework.

It has given us a consistent
approach to evaluate
and design reliable, secure architecture,

regardless of whatever
AWS services we are using.
- We started in real estate,

but today we see ourselves
as a technology company.

Everything we're building,
the new architecture

the new experiences we're
creating and reimagining,
all fundamentally centered around data.

We now have the ability
to have better insights
into what our customer is looking for,

which allows us to better
respond to their needs,

and really that gives us
an edge in our sector.

I think for us, here at
AvalonBay, the sky's the limit.
I don't think there's anything
we can't do being on the AWS cloud.
(inspiring music)
